cyclone.name: ANA
cyclone.current_location: about 170 miles SSE of Myrtle Beach, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Slowly moving north, then turning northwest toward the South Carolina coast, with a gradual curve north-northeast up the U.S. East Coast after landfall.

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach, South Carolina to Cape Lookout, North Carolina
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South Carolina through North Carolina coastline (with additional effects spreading northward along the Mid-Atlantic coast)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (sustained 39–45 mph with higher gusts) are possible Saturday afternoon through early Sunday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant storm-surge flooding expected; elevated surf and rip currents anticipated.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands producing 2–4 inches, locally higher, likely Saturday night through Sunday, causing ponding and minor freshwater flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along area beaches; reduced visibility and squalls affecting vessel operations.
